item.title: Tip 293 - 5 Things you didn't know about Azure Cognitive Services
item.description: Artificial Intelligence enables you to creates smart applications that go beyond simple forms-over-data. Azure Cognitive Services (opens new window) is a family of APIs that provide AI capabilities out-of-the-box, without the need to create algorithms and train them with massive amounts of data. There are Cognitive Services that translate text into another language or synthesize text to speech, others that recognize faces and objects in images and many more.

item.title: How Secure is Your Data Security | Thu 5 Nov midday-12:40pm (AEDT), Hosted online, 5th of November | Humanitix
item.description:
When bad data hacks happen to good startups - why hackers are enjoying COVID and what to do about it. When the US Congress wanted answers about major national data hacks they asked plain speaking Troy Hunt. Today, Troy explains why his business is booming and answers your questions about making customers data properly safe.  TODAY'S EVENT: Freelancer Troy Hunt is a big fan of teaching tech professionals how to break into their own applications - before someone else does. Chat live with Troy at today’s event about what defensive skills software developers need and why your startup’s VPN may not be as safe as you think it is. Troy Hunt is a Microsoft Regional Director and MVP, won the 2020 (ISC)² Global Achievement Award for achievements in cybersecurity. He is the Founder of Have I Been Pwned and Information Security Author and Instructor at Pluralsight. He loves all things security and privacy, and opens his garage door with his watch.Every Thursday @ 12pm is our Business Series: Tune in to connect with business experts sharing their newest ideas about creating growth, managing the pitfalls and keeping the cash flowing. Expand your business sense over a lunch break. Too easy!
ABOUT US This series is brought to you by The Studio, Australia’s creative tech incubator.We're a hub for technology startups and scaleups focused on transformative platforms across all industries. Media, entertainment, music, games, education, business and the creative industries, all are part of our DNA. Through our community, global networks, partners and sponsors, experts and investors, our wide range of programs and events, we support you on the road to success.Become part of Australia media and creative tech ecosystem. Instagram @thestudioau Twitter @thestudioau Facebook /thestudioLTD Linkedin /the-studio-au

Two Paradigms of Personal Computing
item.description: A frequently recurring staple of Hacker News is the personal computing rant: modern computers are black boxes, far too locked down.1 We long for our desktop computers, the early-2000s computing paradigm, and we want to take back control of our data. This essay was inspired by a recent hit on Hacker News, ↩

item.title: Indy Xamarin - Shell in Xamarin.Forms
item.description:
Xamarin.Forms Shell reduces the complexity of mobile application development by providing the fundamental features that most mobile applications require. This includes a common navigation user experience, a URI-based navigation scheme, and an integrated search handler. Come learn all about it at this month's Indy Xamarin meetup!
Presenter: Matt Soucoup, Senior Cloud Advocate, Microsoft
Bio: Matthew Soucoup is a Senior Cloud Developer Advocate at Microsoft spreading the ❤️ of integrating Azure with Xamarin. Matt is also a Pluralsight author and prior to joining Microsoft a founder of a successful consulting firm targeting .NET and web development. Matt loves sharing his passion and insight for mobile and cloud development by blogging, writing articles, presenting at conferences, and producing the wildly successful Channel9 series Partly Cloudy. When not behind a computer screen, Matt gardens hot peppers, rides bikes, and loves Wisconsin micro-brews and cheese. Follow Matt on Twitter at @codemillmatt and his personal blog at codemillmatt.com.

item.title: Entity Framework Community Standup - EF Core 5.0 Collations
item.description:
In this community standup, we'll be showing new features around case sensitivity and collations in 5.0. We'll also provide a glimpse into how these features were designed, and what considerations and constraints guide the EF team - performance, cross-database support, usability and more. Come see how we design EF features under the hood!
Community Links: https://www.theurlist.com/efcore-standup-2020-10-28
Featuring: Arthur Vickers @ajcvickers, Shay Rojansky @shayrojansky
#EntityFramework #EFCore #DotNet

item.title: Organize Code by Feature | Vertical Slices
item.description:
Stop thinking of horizontal layers and start thinking about vertical slices. Can you tell what an application does by looking at it's file structure? What functionality it provides? Tired of navigating through a pile projects and folders to implement a new feature? Stop organizing by technical concern and start organizing by features and capabilities. This means looking at your application in vertical slices rather than horizontal layers
🔔 Subscribe: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3RKA4vunFAfrfxiJhPEplw?sub_confirmation=1
0:00 Technical Layers 1:32 MVC Example 3:40 Vertical Slice 4:35 Organized by Feature 7:20 Benefits
CodeOpinon: https://codeopinion.com Twitter: https://twitter.com/codeopinion
#softwarearchitecture #softwaredesign #dotnet
item.author: (CodeOpinion)

item.title: Windows Runtime objects are represented by their default interface, so choose your default interface wisely | The Old New Thing
item.description: As I noted some time ago, in the Windows Runtime, objects are represented at the ABI by a pointer to their default interface. The choice of default interface is usually obvious, but on occasion, the non-obvious choice may be better. If your runtime object supports only one interface,
item.author: (Raymond Chen Follow)
